item.title: Report E-2024110002
item.description:
Report E-2024110002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-04T12:23:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-25
  • City: SUWANEE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 25, 2024, one (1) half-gallon (0.5) pail of nitric acid was damaged in transit and released approximately one-half gallon (0.5) of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the nitric acid-impacted impacted pallet, cardboard boxes, and trailer floor. One (1) damaged jug of nitric acid was containerized into one (1) 5-gallon pail and labeled as hazardous. All impacted debris, spent absorbents, and PPE were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024110001
item.description:
Report E-2024110001

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-04T12:23:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-23
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 23, 2024, twelve (12) 5-gallon pails of UN3266 were crushed in transit and released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove the product. All impacted materials and damaged pails were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.
